alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 10:28PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Chesterfield, Kershaw and Lancaster. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pageland, Kershaw, Chesterfield, Elgin, Mt Pisgah, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Buford, Jefferson, Ruby, Mount Croghan, Central High School, High Point Fire Station, Taxahaw, Forty Acre Rock Preserve, Tradesville, Kershaw Correctional Institution, Bay Springs Fire Station, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School, Antioch and Kirk Air Base. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown. Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
